column4: Hi everyone.  I have a printer that OpenPrinting.org lists as a "paperweight", and another that's not listed on there at all.  Does this mean that there's no way for me to get these printers to work with Ubuntu?

Both printers work fine on Windows, but the manufacturers don't support Linux, and I can't find Linux drivers... is there any way I can get these to work?  maybe through wine (or something else) using the Windows drivers?
if you are running CUPS go to http://localhost:631 to config your printers
sorry, don't know what CUPS is, so I'm not using it unless it ships with Ubuntu
